piccross

Class PiccrossModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • piccross.PiccrossModel

  • public class PiccrossModel
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will have all the logic related to our game which will intact with view

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PiccrossModel.numPanel
      This class is used to create numPanel object which is a JPanel with a int value

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) int count
      Represents number of buttons received from a game send by server.
      private static boolean[][] gridBool
      Represents the true grid which will be true or false depending on random generation of the game.
      private static boolean[][] gridBoolSelected
      Represents the boxes that are selected by the user.
      private static javax.swing.JButton[][] gridButtons
      gridButtons will hold buttons which will represent our grid.
      (package private) javax.swing.JPanel gridPanel
      gridPanel will hold the 5x5 gridPanel for our Picross game.
      private int gridSelected
      Represents the total boxes that user selected.
      private int[] intArr
      Represents the space saved for hints
      private boolean mark
      Represents if mark check box is set or not.
      (package private) PiccrossModel.numPanel[][] numberPanel
      numPanel will hold the hints to our Picross game.
      private int points
      Represents the points of the user.
      private javax.swing.JTextField pointTextField
      Represents the text field which will hold the points for the user.
      private boolean showSolution
      Represents if we want to show solution or not to user.
      private int trueButtons
      Represents total of true boxes that we have in this random game.
      private int trueSelected
      Represents number of boxes that are correctly selected.

      no arg contractor for PicrossModel objects.

      This method is a getter for showSolution.

      This method will be used when ever we are reseting the game with same grid boxes.

      Method will send the current game in Piccross to server.

      This method is setter which will set the mark to true or false.

      This method is a setter for showSolution.

      This method will set up the gridPanel which will hold the hints and grid boxes.

      This method will setup each button with receiving the i and j which will indicate which button we are setting up on our 2D-Array of buttons.
      void setupHints()
      This method will set up hints for our game depending on what is inside random generated boxes.
      void showSolution()
      This method will show the correct boxes with changing the background of box to green.

    • Field Detail

      • count

        int count
        Represents number of buttons received from a game send by server.

      • mark

        private boolean mark
        Represents if mark check box is set or not.

      • showSolution

        private boolean showSolution
        Represents if we want to show solution or not to user.

      • gridBool

        private static boolean[][] gridBool
        Represents the true grid which will be true or false depending on random generation of the game.

      • gridBoolSelected

        private static boolean[][] gridBoolSelected
        Represents the boxes that are selected by the user.

      • points

        private int points
        Represents the points of the user.

      • trueSelected

        private int trueSelected
        Represents number of boxes that are correctly selected.

      • gridSelected

        private int gridSelected
        Represents the total boxes that user selected.

      • trueButtons

        private int trueButtons
        Represents total of true boxes that we have in this random game.

      • pointTextField

        private final javax.swing.JTextField pointTextField
        Represents the text field which will hold the points for the user.

      • intArr

        private int[] intArr
        Represents the space saved for hints

      • gridButtons

        private static javax.swing.JButton[][] gridButtons
        gridButtons will hold buttons which will represent our grid. each button represents one of the squares in our grid. It has +1 because we need one on each row and column to show the hints.

      • gridPanel

        javax.swing.JPanel gridPanel
        gridPanel will hold the 5x5 gridPanel for our Picross game. this can be changed to other dimensions such as 10x10.

      • numberPanel

        PiccrossModel.numPanel[][] numberPanel
        numPanel will hold the hints to our Picross game. It is part of the gridLayout in our gridPanel.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PiccrossModel

        public PiccrossModel()
        no arg contractor for PicrossModel objects.

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public void setup(int debugMode)
        This method will set up the gridPanel which will hold the hints and grid boxes.
        Parameters:
        debugMode - used to indicate either to generate random games or predefined games.

      • setup

        private boolean setup(int i,
                      int j,
                      int debugMode)
        This method will setup each button with receiving the i and j which will indicate which button we are setting up on our 2D-Array of buttons. It also add the MouseEvent listener to each buttons so we can detect we a button is pushed.
        Parameters:
        i - represents the index for our 2D-Array of buttons.
        j - represents the index for our 2D-Array of buttons.
        debugMode - represents in which mode setup method will be called.
        Returns:
        Returns true if button is true and false if button is false.

      • sendGameToServer

        public void sendGameToServer()
        Method will send the current game in Piccross to server.

      • addHints

        public void addHints()
        Method will set up and add hint to our gridPanel layout.

      • setupHints

        public void setupHints()
        This method will set up hints for our game depending on what is inside random generated boxes.

      • showSolution

        public void showSolution()
        This method will show the correct boxes with changing the background of box to green. If we run the same method again it will go back to original color which means solution will go away.

      • getGridPanel

        public javax.swing.JPanel getGridPanel()
        This method is a getter for gridPanel which will be used in view.
        Returns:
        Returns gridPanel to other classes.

      • isShowSolution

        public boolean isShowSolution()
        This method is a getter for showSolution.
        Returns:
        Returns boolean value of showSolution.

      • getPointTextField

        public javax.swing.JTextField getPointTextField()
        This method is a getter for pointTextField.
        Returns:
        pointTextField which will represent the space in UI which will hold the points for the user.

      • setMark

        public void setMark(boolean mark)
        This method is setter which will set the mark to true or false.
        Parameters:
        mark - represents if we are trying to find true boxes or false boxes in the game.

      • resetGame

        public void resetGame()
        This method will be used when ever we are reseting the game with same grid boxes.

      • setShowSolution

        public void setShowSolution(boolean showSolution)
        This method is a setter for showSolution.
        Parameters:
        showSolution - represents boolean value that if set to true will show the correct boxes if false will not.

      • gameDone

        public void gameDone()
        This method will disable the boxes after the game is done.
